meanings.definition: To swim faster than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah was outswimming her competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Michael trained hard to improve his speed and finally succeeded in outswimming his friends.
meanings.sent3: The turtle challenged the rabbit to a swimming contest, confident in outswimming it.
meanings.sent4: With determination and practice, she was outswimming her own doubts and fears.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's speed in the water was outswimming all other animals.

meanings.sent1: In the ocean, the dolphin was outswimming the shark, showing its superior swimming skills.
meanings.sent2: Despite his small size, the young swimmer was outswimming the older, more experienced competitors.
meanings.sent3: The fish outswimming the fishing net was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her determination and focus allowed her to outswim her previous records.
meanings.sent5: The champion swimmer was outswimming all expectations with each stroke.
